div.p: It was a big win for Latina/os when they finally got to name one of their parks after one of their Champions. On October 15, 2015, Senator Ricardo Lara cut the ribbon commemorating a park under his name. A city who once protested against changing the name of one of their streets from 'Century Blvd' to 'Martin Luther King Jr Blvd,' for the first time, is naming a public space after a Latino. The new park runs for five blocks adjacent to the 105 freeway. It comes with a dog park, children’s playground, a community garden, and Eco-friendly Bioswales. It takes into account the residents who are cut off from Lynwood’s central park due to 105 freeway. In creating open space, it gives room for community engagement and future cultural celebrations.

note.p: Ricardo Lara Linear Park has a dog park, children’s playground, a community garden, and eco-friendly bioswales. Named after Senator Ricardo Lara, a champion for the Latino Community.
